Several examples in the Docs are not valid HTML.

I decided to open this issue which includes multiple closely related issues in order to reduce the bureaucratic overhead.

### Description

I had several issues with the W3C Validator when copy/pasting HTML from the Bulma docs. The service marked some parts of my HTML as an error or warning so I decided to go through all the docs and filter out those examples which produce invalid HTML:

- [Starter template](https://bulma.io/documentation/overview/start/#starter-template)
- [Disabled link examples](https://bulma.io/documentation/modifiers/syntax/)
- [Every example of media objects](https://bulma.io/documentation/layout/media-object/)
- [Fullheight Hero with Navbar](https://bulma.io/documentation/layout/hero/)
- [Fullheight Hero in 3 parts](https://bulma.io/documentation/layout/hero/#fullheight-hero-in-3-parts)
- [Tiles example](https://bulma.io/documentation/layout/tiles/#example)
- [Tiles - Nesting requirements](https://bulma.io/documentation/layout/tiles/#nesting-requirements)
- [Tiles - 3 columns](https://bulma.io/documentation/layout/tiles/#3-columns)
- [Tiles - 4 columns](https://bulma.io/documentation/layout/tiles/#4-columns)
- [Disabled checkbox](https://bulma.io/documentation/form/checkbox/)
- [Disabled Radio button](https://bulma.io/documentation/form/radio/)
- [Box](https://bulma.io/documentation/elements/box/)
- [Delete combinations](https://bulma.io/documentation/elements/delete/#combinations)
- [Every example of Image](https://bulma.io/documentation/elements/image/)
- [The first table example](https://bulma.io/documentation/elements/table/)
- [The first 2 examples of Card](https://bulma.io/documentation/components/card/)
- [Every example of Message](https://bulma.io/documentation/components/message/)
- [Card Modal](https://bulma.io/documentation/components/modal/)
- [Basic Navbar](https://bulma.io/documentation/components/navbar/#basic-navbar)
- [Navbar Brand](https://bulma.io/documentation/components/navbar/#navbar-brand)
- [Navbar Menu first example](https://bulma.io/documentation/components/navbar/#navbar-menu)
- [Transparent Navbar](https://bulma.io/documentation/components/navbar/#transparent-navbar)
- [Dropdown Menu](https://bulma.io/documentation/components/navbar/#dropdown-menu)
- [Every example of Pagination](https://bulma.io/documentation/components/pagination/)
- [Panel Colors](https://bulma.io/documentation/components/panel/#colors)

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Go to the [W3C Validator](https://validator.w3.org/#validate_by_input) website
2. Paste in this HMTL skeleton
```
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
<title>Bulma</title>
</head>
<body>
{example}
</body>
</html>
```
3. Replace {example} which each example mentioned above.

### Expected behavior

The [W3C Validator](https://validator.w3.org/#validate_by_input) should not show errors or warnings for each of the examples mentioned above.

### Actual behavior

The [W3C Validator](https://validator.w3.org/#validate_by_input) shows errors and/or warnings for each of the examples mentioned above.

Issues.Title: Removing .container fixed width values makes column size depend on content
Issues.Body: This is about **Bulma**. ### Overview of the problem This is about the Bulma **CSS framework** I'm using Bulma **version** 0.8.2. My **browser** is: Safari, Chrome, Firefox ### Description I just upgraded from 0.7.2 to 0.8.2 and my single-column layouts have gone wrong. On my login page I want the form to be horizontally centered, and take up half the width of the page. ``` .container .columns.is-centered .column.is-half [login form] ``` This worked well with 0.7.2. However after 0.7.5 and #2297, a column with a size modifier no longer has a predictable width. If the login form has some text blurb which is "long", the form behaves as expected. But if the login form doesn't have any wide child elements, the form shrinks to the width of the input fields which is far less than half the width of the container. It looks weird. This seems to be because the desktop container used to have a fixed width of 960px but now its width is auto. In the screenshots the container has a blue outline; and the `.columns` div has a green outline; and the `.column` has an orange outline. ### Expected behavior The container should be the width of the screen. ### Actual behavior The container shrinks its width, causing my `.is-half` column, when not containing any long text, to shrink to half the width the container chose.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Removing .container fixed width values makes column size depend on content" (#2950)

Issues.Title: is-narrow inconsistent
Issues.Body:
This is about **Bulma and the Docs**. ### Overview of the problem Bulma behaves differently from what is implied in the docs about responsive behavior of the grid column system. Particularly how the `is-narrow-*` classes interact with the other width classes of the grid system, e.g., `is-one-quarter-*` . I'm using Bulma **version** [0.8.2] Might be related to #2783 -- Not clear: description in that issue is not too verbose. ### Steps to Reproduce Consider the following snippet ```html
is-one-quarter-tablet
is-narrow-desktop
2
3
4
5
``` ### Expected behavior You would expect this to be a quarter sized column at the tablet break point. And then be a narrow column for the desktop and larger breakpoints. At least this is what is implied in the documentation sections `Different column sizes per breakpoint` and `Narrow column`. ### Actual behavior The column is quarter sized for all breakpoints larger than tablet. ### Potential Solution It seems that the `width` field set in ```sass &.is-one-quarter-tablet flex: none width: 25% ``` is never `unset` in ```sass &.is-narrow-desktop flex: none ``` This seems to be what #2783 is pointing to. Either the documentation should be changed to clarify this, or the width should be unset (I am not sure if this interacts badly with any other Bulma components).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "is-narrow inconsistent" (#2937)

I have searched for a duplicate issue and not found any.

### Description

Can you _please_ consider having all the docs on a single page like every other CSS framework? I can't express how much of a nightmare it is to browse those docs. It's incredibly difficult to find what I need, and even when I know where it is, I still have to click through several things to get there. If it was all on a single page, I could ctrl-f to anything I needed instantly.

This would also be really beneficial for onboarding new developers, as they would be able to scroll through and see everything that bulma has to offer. I didn't know certain things were possible, until I stumbled upon them by chance in the docs while looking for something else. This is made worse by the fact that the sections/subsections are organised in a way that isn't very intuitive to me. I would much rather be able to just search something like "center" and see if there are classes related to centering, etc.
